items.summary: Remove the red 'Access Denied' message UI from the Admin Panel flow so it no longer blocks access to the password input. Specifically, eliminate the destructive alert box rendered by the current access-denied screen from admin navigation/guards (and remove any references that cause it to render for the Admin Panel unlock flow).

Replace the current modal-based admin password gate with a simple, visible, in-page login form rendered directly inside the Admin Panel page when the admin session is not unlocked (no modals/popups). The form must have: (1) headline text exactly 'Admin Login', (2) a password input (type='password') with placeholder exactly 'Enter Password', and (3) a large green button labeled exactly 'Unlock Dashboard'.

Implement the requested unlock logic for the in-page Admin Panel login form: on clicking 'Unlock Dashboard', validate the password exactly against '@ni#ra&j*gurja:r'. If correct, call localStorage.setItem('isAdmin','true') and refresh the Admin Panel section so the dashboard content becomes visible. If incorrect, show a standard browser alert with text exactly 'Wrong Password' (no extra punctuation).

Hide Admin Panel dashboard controls until successfully unlocked: only render the 'Job Posts', 'Settings', and 'Manage Quiz' buttons/controls after localStorage 'isAdmin' has been set to 'true' (i.e., after successful unlock).
